Package org.opengrok.indexer.authorization

Class AuthorizationStack

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opengrok.indexer.authorization.AuthorizationEntity
      • org.opengrok.indexer.authorization.AuthorizationStack
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, Nameable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AuthorizationPlugin
    public class AuthorizationStack
extends AuthorizationEntity
    Subclass of AuthorizationEntity. It implements the methods to be able to contain and making decision for:
    • other stacks
    • plugins
    Author:
    Krystof Tulinger
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        Parameters:

      • load

        public void load​(Map<String,​Object> parameters)
        Load all authorization entities in this stack.

        If the method is unable to load any of the entities contained in this stack then this stack is marked as failed. Note that it does not affect the authorization decision made by this stack.

        Specified by:
        load in class AuthorizationEntity
        Parameters:
        parameters - parameters given in the configuration
        See Also:
        IAuthorizationPlugin.load(java.util.Map)

      • unload

        public void unload()
        Unload all plugins contained in this stack.
        Specified by:
        unload in class AuthorizationEntity
        See Also:
        IAuthorizationPlugin.unload()

      • isAllowed

        public boolean isAllowed​(Nameable entity,
                         AuthorizationEntity.PluginDecisionPredicate pluginPredicate,
                         AuthorizationEntity.PluginSkippingPredicate skippingPredicate)
        Test the given entity if it should be allowed with in this stack context if and only if the stack is not marked as failed.
        Specified by:
        isAllowed in class AuthorizationEntity
        Parameters:
        entity - the given entity - this is either group or project and is passed just for the logging purposes.
        pluginPredicate - predicate returning true or false for the given entity which determines if the authorization for such entity is successful or failed for particular request and plugin
        skippingPredicate - predicate returning true if this authorization entity should be omitted from the authorization process
        Returns:
        true if successful; false otherwise

      • processStack

        protected boolean processStack​(Nameable entity,
                               AuthorizationEntity.PluginDecisionPredicate pluginPredicate,
                               AuthorizationEntity.PluginSkippingPredicate skippingPredicate)
        Process the stack.
        Parameters:
        entity - the given entity
        pluginPredicate - predicate returning true or false for the given entity which determines if the authorization for such entity is successful or failed for particular request and plugin
        skippingPredicate - predicate returning true if this authorization entity should be omitted from the authorization process
        Returns:
        true if entity is allowed; false otherwise

      • setPlugin

        public boolean setPlugin​(IAuthorizationPlugin plugin)
        Set the plugin to all classes in this stack which requires this class in the configuration. This creates a new instance of the plugin for each class which needs it.

        This is where the loaded plugin classes get to be a part of the authorization process. When the AuthorizationPlugin does not get its IAuthorizationPlugin it is marked as failed and returns false to all authorization decisions.

        Specified by:
        setPlugin in class AuthorizationEntity
        Parameters:
        plugin - the new instance of a plugin
        Returns:
        true if there is such case; false otherwise

      • clone

        public AuthorizationStack clone()
        Clones the stack. Performs:
        • copy the superclass AuthorizationEntity
        • perform a deep copy of the contained stack
        Specified by:
        clone in class AuthorizationEntity
        Returns:
        new instance of AuthorizationStack

      • hierarchyToString

        public String hierarchyToString​(String prefix,
                                String colorElement)
        Print the stack hierarchy. Process also all contained plugins and substacks.
        Specified by:
        hierarchyToString in class AuthorizationEntity
        Parameters:
        prefix - this prefix should be prepended to every line produced by this stack
        colorElement - a possible element where any occurrence of %color% will be replaced with a HTML HEX color representing this entity state.
        Returns:
        the string containing this stack representation
